oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Every night before the bedtime story of the Hungarian Television, the TV Teddy Bear checks in, who celebrated its 49th birthday in 2012. The teddy bear starring in this show first appeared in Easter 1963, and stayed on screen until 1982.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A group of traditionalists reeancted scenes from the battle of Szolnok during a historic war game in Szolnok. The battle of Szolnok on 5 March 1849 was the overture of the Easter Campaign.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Water, water, clean water
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Duna TelevÃ­ziÃ³
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: environmental issues
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This documentary introduces the water-dwelling wildlife of the Carpathian Basin. The makers of the documentary sought out the rivers, creeks and lakes where the water was clear enough to capture the beauty of this underwater world on film. The film grants viewers a glimpse to an hitherto unseen and hidden world.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Is Budapest a livable, evolving city?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Duna TelevÃ­ziÃ³
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: living in cities
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Evolving city? Livable city? Habitable city? The program attempts to analyze the problems that Budapest is facing. The advantages and disadvantages of the existing city development concepts are discussed. The current situation of the Hungarian construction sector is reviewed, with an extra focus on the growing number of new buildings displaying a lack of imagination, or even of taste. This is followed by an analysis of the reasons behind the lack of public areas dedicated for community life. The program presents the changes in the demographics of the Hungarian capital, and closes by taking a look at the harmful effects and health consequences of urban pollution.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Ecorope: for cleaner cities
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Duna TelevÃ­ziÃ³
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: environmental issues
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The program presents the steps and measures taken by Europe for fighting the pollution-related health consequences of city life. The program takes a look at the problems caused by increasing traffic in large cities, and reviews some of the attempts authorities are making to improve the situation. A wide-range, pan-European program aimed at improving urban living environments in the EU is presented. The program discusses the issues of electronic and household electronic waste; of environmental damage caused by car traffic; of the possibilities for better waste management.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Agriculture in the HortobÃ¡gy National Park
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Duna TelevÃ­ziÃ³
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: agriculture
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This episode of the economic programme presents the economic activities of the HortobÃ¡gy National Park and the changes in the lives of the people living here. HortobÃ¡gy is the oldest national park in Hungary, a world heritage site. The introduction of solar panels and satellite dishes have brought great changes in the lives of the shepherds.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bioscoopjournaals waarin Nederlandse onderwerpen van een bepaalde week worden gepresenteerd.Bij Lopik vindt in de weilanden de bouw van de eerste Nederlandse televisiezender gestaag voortgang. De eigenlijke zendmast staat al overeind; op de top ervan wordt de zendantenne gemonteerd. In een gebouwtje vlak naast de zendmast is de electronische apparatuur voor beeld en geluid ondergebracht. Technici zijn aan de div. panelen druk bezig met installeren en afregelen.

Newsreels in which Dutch subjects of a certain week are presented.The construction of the first television transmitter in the fields near Lopik progresses steadily. The actual mast is already up; the broadcasting aerial will be mounted on top of it. The electronical equipment for images and sound is stored in a small building next to the transmitter. Technicians are busy installing and tuning at several control panels.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Nederlands Instituut voor Beeld en Geluid

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Kabinetscrisis
The fall of the government
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Polygoon-Profilti (producent) / Nederlands Instituut voor Beeld en Geluid (beheerder)
Polygoon-Profilti (producer) / Netherlands Institute for Sound and Vision (curator)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tweede Kamer
omroeporganisaties
Paleis Soestdijk
regeringscrises
mediabeleid
Paleis Huis ten Bosch
Kabinet-Marijnen
House of Representatives
broadcasting organisations
Palace Soestdijk
fall of the government
media policy
Palace Huis ten Bosch
Marijnen Cabinet
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bioscoopjournaals waarin Nederlandse onderwerpen van een bepaalde week worden gepresenteerd.De loper wordt uitgelegd bij Paleis Soestdijk en fotografen staan bij het hek in afwachting van minister-president V.G.M. Marijnen. Even later arriveert Marijnen om het ontslag van zijn kabinet in te dienen als gevolg van onenigheid over het omroepbeleid. Twee dagen later komt de Tweede Kamer bijeen op verzoek van Anne Vondeling, waarbij hij aangeeft dat hij de oorzaak van de kabinetscrisis niet begrijpt en daarom niet als adviseur van de koningin wil optreden. Vervolgens woont Marijnen de discussie in de Kamer bij. Vondeling vraagt om uitleg, maar deze motie wordt verworpen, waarna de vergadering wordt gesloten. Vervolgens arriveren op Paleis Huis Ten Bosch de fractieleiders Norbert Schmelzer van de KVP, Vondeling van de PvdA en Molly Geertsema van de VVD voor een gesprek met Juliana.

Newsreels in which Dutch subjects of a certain week are presented.The red carpet is rolled out at Palace Soestdijk and photographers wait at the gate for the arrival of Prime Minister V.G.M. Marijnen. A while later Marijnenn arrives to hand in the resignation of his cabinet as a result of the disagreement on broadcasting policy. The House of Representatives gathers two days later after a request made by Anne Vondeling, where he declares he doesn't understand the reason for the fall of the government and therefore doesn't want to act as advisor for the queen. Then Marijnen attends the discussion in the House of Representatives. Vondeling asks for an explanation, but this motion is rejected after which the meeting is adjourned. Then the party leaders Norbert Schmelzer of the KVP, Vondeling of the PvdA and Molly Geertsema of the VVD arrive at Palace Huis ten Bosch for a consultation with Juliana.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Nederlands Instituut voor Beeld en Geluid

Newsreels in which Dutch subjects of a certain week are presented.Steel piles are driven into the North Sea on which the REM island (a pirate broadcasting platform) will be build.
